review_title: A college that lacks vision, relevancy, and nimbleness

review_title: A Great Place to Work (If you can get in)
job_title: Career Specialist in La Mirada, CA
pros:
-Great, hardworking, and friendly team.
-Good/wholesome (non-toxic)university culture both amongst students, faculty, and staff
-Incredible benefits: full dental, medical, vision, 403 B retirement, and tuition discounts = years in full-time employment
-Lots of opportunities to learn, participate and be a part of the university tradition and culture. 
-Great leadership!
-Summer hours are reduced due to the campus being off for the summer session. 
-
cons:
-Culture is not for everyone: religious, private, small, largely conservative-leaning, liberal-arts higher education institution. 
-University has difficulty as a non-profit institution, there is constant anxiety about money, funding, donations, admissions. Often you would hear "We just don't have the money for......"
-There is arguably an underlining issue of diversity, equity, and affordability amongst students within the campus.

If you have opinions that differ from the norm/traditional views you will be relegated to the sideline.

job_title: Marketing in La Mirada, CA
pros:
- The work environment is really incredible. At least, it is in my department. The people are fun, hardworking, encouraging and kind. 
- They pay for a good chunk of health care which is nice. 
- They offer an unheard of 8% match on 401K
- The university closes for Christmas which is incredible 
- In summer, we get half days on Friday's. Work 4 hours get 4 hours. 
- If you are hourly, the work life balance is amazing. 
- They offer tuition reimbursement! Amazing for people with children or spouses or who are trying to go back to school. 



Biola is truly led by some of the most incredible people I’ve ever met. They deeply care about the university, the students and higher education. If you are looking for a good work environment and have some experience this is a great place to work.
cons:
- The pay. It’s really bad for Southern California and it seems like they take advantage of recent college grads. 
- The nonprofit work can move at a high speed, but then quickly come to a halt with tons of red tape. I guess this is less of a con and more of an insight.  
- There isn’t a way to move up the ladder easily. My opportunities are incredibly limited here in terms of career advancement. 
- Constantly fighting a lack of resources and turnover.

pros: Friendly supervisor and coworkers. Easy to apply

job_title: Anonymous Employee in La Mirada, CA
pros: Great culture and mission. Lots of very nice and talented people working here. The work is very meaningful and the mission of the organization is lived out in significant ways. You feel like what you do matters in the world and has a positive impact.
cons: Pay is painfully low and that can be discouraging over time. Some people have been there for a very long time and lack creativity/flexibility/ willingness to innovate. Depending on the area/department some people are trying new things and others are entrenched in old way of thinking/doing things & think the university will go on forever without adapting to the changing demands/needs of the market.

review_title: Being a student worker was the best!
job_title: Human Resources Office Assistant in La Mirada, CA
pros: The HR department staff was awesome to work with as a student worker! For me, it was low stress, I had a great boss who was flexible with my hours, great staff to work with--I really can't complain about anything. I miss working there!
cons: I saw many of my staff-coworkers deal with the weight of people leaving the department because the positions were not replaced, but instead delegated out. The HR department is severely understaffed and not prioritized by the executive staff.

review_title: Good temporary job for a student
job_title: Teaching Assistant in La Mirada, CA
pros:
Decent temporary job for a student, likely in a relevant field, especially if you're working with a good professor.
Workload is fairly light - you may need to be there during class times, depending on the class, and can only have up to 5 hours per week of work.  So it's really only one class and 2 or 3 hours outside of class.
cons:
Some profs are difficult and disorganized.  If that's the case, you will likely be over on your hours (and not getting paid for it), and potentially have things thrown on you last-minute requiring a quick turn around.  
Low pay, no benefits, potentially weird hours depending on the class.

review_title: Community at work and great staff development!
job_title: Registration Assistant in La Mirada, CA
pros: Biola University takes great care of their employees with staff development opportunities.  As an alum of the school, it felt great to give back.
cons: I wouldn't have been able to support a family off of my most recent salary there, which is one reason why I left to start my own business, but if I'd chosen to stay, there certainly would have been other positions opening up into which I could grow financially.

job_title: Programmer/Analyst in La Mirada, CA
pros: Great work environment, very good benefits and medical (had Kaiser for 4 years, no complaints), flexible and understanding management, very low stress, good climate (SoCal), PTO is generous: 2 weeks anytime PTO + week between Christmas and New Year's + Half-day fridays during the summer and inter-term - 5 weeks altogether. Management genuinely concerned about employee's wellbeing and actively works towards their professional development. Relative proximity to LA, Disneyland (if that's your thing) and beaches
cons: Pay is lower than industry average, things happen slowly (see the part about no-stress in the Pro's), little room for advancement in many departments because of low turn-over rate. Though the campus itself is very nice, the surrounding area is typical, ugly suburban LA.

review_title: I have loved my experiences here during my time of growth and there was a great community of people.
job_title: Student Athletic Trainer/Fitness Monitor/Chapel Scanner/Lifeguard in La Mirada, CA
pros: Bosses are encouraging, the workplace is almost always positive and they are willing to work with your schedule as a student. Also while working here I was able to connect with people in different countries and with a variety of backgrounds.
cons: Sometimes it is easy to slack off and not get as challenged as you might if you were in a secular workplace.

review_title: A Good place to work but not without its faults.
job_title: Teaching Assistant in Whittier, CA
pros: For the most part people are friendly and willing to help you do well at whatever job you may have. Depending on where you get hired, pay is good for a part-time university job.
cons: It is very competitive to get a student job, so if you don't apply before the beginning of the semester, chances are you aren't going to get one. As always, it's not what you know, it's who you know, which makes it that much more difficult to get hired.

job_title: Writing Center Consultant in La Mirada, CA
pros: The Writing Center is an excellent place to work, with good employees, management, and clients. The top brass is always looking to improve training and provide resources to employees, the staff is well-picked for both quality work and amiable working conditions (I made some excellent friends there), and clients are, more often than not, respectful of your time and help. You also get to pick your own hours, which is nice.
cons: Not much, honestly. Sometimes it's hard to contact our head boss, but the coordinators are usually easily reached. Some clients are easily stressed out or frustrated due to the difficulty of their assignments.

job_title: Admin in La Mirada, CA
pros: Great vacation time! Christ-centered environment.
cons: impossible to save for your future with an entry level position.  also your office will likely be understaffed and management during my time seemed always close to burnout.  expect to take on a much heavier workload than any other job for much less pay and expect that your supervisor will push you to your limit.  On paper you will be given a lot of vacation time, but you will rarely if ever be able to use it because of the academic "busy seasons" which will always happen consecutively.  very poor work life balance.

job_title: Business Development Manager in La Mirada, CA
pros: Really good on-campus leadership experience, fantastic way to learn basic skills and tools that can be used for future jobs, supportive team of students with great advices and directions from faculty advisor, Dr. Longinow.
cons: Very minimum wage -- as in, not enough budget, and thus we're paid minimum wage + half of the hours we actually work, also school does not allow us to get paid for overtime, apparently this is legal?

job_title: Admission's Counselor in La Mirada, CA
pros: Biola has an encouraging and edifying culture. It is a great place to grow as a professional. The benefits are great, both health and retirement benefits. There is an 8% company match in the 401(k) plan. You are surrounded by people that constantly encourage both professionally and in your faith in Jesus Christ.
cons: Biola has too much transparency between the employees. The pay is not competitive amongst the industry and there is little room for growth within the company. It takes years to move up the ladder.

job_title: Campus Safety Cadet in Kailua, HI
pros: Biola is a great place to work for especially as a student! I started out as a cadet for Campus Safety and really enjoyed getting to know my superiors and fellow student workers. The job isn't stressful and they work around your school schedule so that you can make studies your main focus. It is also one of the best paying jobs on campus!
cons: The job can switch from being repetitive and slow to stressful at any point during your shift. It isn't too hard to manage but it is something to keep in mind!

review_title: Wonderful and dynamic co-workers but limited pay
job_title: Resident Assistant in La Mirada, CA
pros: The people! Employees, students, and faculty are required to sign a statement of faith. This plays a large role in establishing the wonderful Christian community that is present at Biola.
cons: While the people at Biola are fantastic, the pay is not a huge draw. I made more money at other jobs than I did here.

review_title: Challenging, meaningful work in a great environment
job_title: Anonymous Employee in La Mirada, CA
pros: Great co-workers who are inspired by the university's Christian mission and genuinely care about each other; a lot of exciting initiatives; half-day Fridays in the summer; generous benefits (esp. for retirement); fun to interact with college students; beautiful campus; very positive and pleasant environment; supportive of professional development
cons: Can sometimes be slow moving; pay isn't the highest since it is a non-profit (but very comparable for similar organizations); the campus is getting a little tight with the growth of students and employees

review_title: The IT Help desk is definitely a "team" that works together
job_title: IT Helpdesk Representative in La Mirada, CA
pros: There is a sense of unity in the IT Department. If one person can't figure out an issue, there's always someone else in the department, no matter their job title, who can and will help.
cons: It is hard work that requires an extra bit of poise and professionalism since your customers are standing in front of you the entire time that you are working through the tech issues.

job_title: Undergraduate Student In the Crowell School of Business in La Mirada, CA
pros: Biola is an amazing school and truly knows how to challenge and grow students. The professors are heavily invested in student life and there are hundreds of ways students can further connect to the school. The business department is also great and gives students the tools needed to succeed in any environment.
cons: My experience at Biola has been nothing but amazing. From a student's perspective, Biola is an amazing place where the staff and administration know how to care about their students.

job_title: in La Mirada, CA
pros: A great community exists at Biola, one where people genuinely care for each other and seek each other's best interests. It is a great place to work.
cons: As a private Christian university, some of the salary ranges are a bit low, but HR is seeking to become more competitive in that regard.

review_title: Supportive and growing atmosphere at Biola
job_title: Academic Advising in La Mirada, CA
pros: There is competitive pay, loving bosses who want to see you succeed, personable staff who care about you as more than just their employees, honoring atmosphere, opportunity to move up in position, ability to have freedom while still being under supervision
cons: Sometimes awkward interactions with bosses outside the workplace while still on campus.

review_title: A Bad Place to be a Student Worker
job_title: Food Service in La Mirada, CA
pros: Not a lot to say here; most people are better off working elsewhere if they need help with college finances. Generally speaking, your fellow student employees are great to work with.
cons: Lack of trust between management and workers; upper-level managers spend half their time micro-managing employees when they should be addressing procedural and staffing issues. No room for advancement or pay increases; almost everyone above an entry-level position is brought in from the outside.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in La Mirada, CA
pros: Biola is a wonderful community of individuals, very friendly, supportive and possesses strong values.  Compared to most other employers, the university is an excellent place for individuals to grow and flourish.  The compensation is fair and the benefits are above average.
cons: It can be challenging to figure your way around when you're new to Biola.  Despite this, there is always someone willing to offer their help and provide assistance.

review_title: Great campus, but sometimes challenging to advance
job_title: in Anaheim, CA
pros: The people here are great and really make this a wonderful place to work for.  The students give such life and vivacity to the campus.
cons: Biola is very much an insider's club.  Getting your foot in the door can be very challenging unless you have some connections internally.  It can be challenging for women to move into upper leadership roles above director levels.

job_title: Facilities Services in La Mirada, CA
pros: Great students and environment. Management can be flexible and gracious with employees. President Correy is very well liked among all employees. Pay raised after first year.
cons: Lack of trust between management and lower level employees in the Facilities Services department. Not the most resources available to employees. Slow in implementing suggested changes from ground workers.

job_title: Resident Advisor in La Mirada, CA
pros: Biola is intentional with making their faculty, and staff feel known and cared for. They are great at being resources for their students.
cons: One of the hard things about working at Biola is the lack of urgency from administration solving issues from their students.

job_title: Marketing Director for SMU in La Mirada, CA
pros:
- Very happy environment over all even during busy seasons
- Meaningful relationships with others on staff
- Great place to build strengths due to encouraging management
cons:
- Felt overworked at times considering the pay
- Relaxed attitude may not be the best for all people

job_title: Resident Advisor in Los Angeles, CA
pros: They really focus on investing in who you are becoming as a person. Plenty of opportunities to learn how to work with people.
cons: The monetary compensation  for the amount of hours you work is pore. Also you are placed in a weird position as a peer authority.

job_title: Trust Officer in La Mirada, CA
pros: Biola is a friendly, encouraging workplace that values honesty and integrity. Compensation is very fair and includes a number of ancillary benefits such as access to campus facilities.
cons: I have no complaints about working at Biola University. The university was a wonderful place to work, and I could not have asked for better co-workers or management.

job_title: Circulation and Access Services Assistant
pros: Wonderful supervisors, schedules your shifts around your class schedule, provides opportunities for growth. Great for someone who enjoys a quiet, organized environment.
cons: Hours are limited to 25/week due to regulations. Little to no benefits as a student employee.

review_title: Biola is an amazing employer! I grew so much working here.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in La Mirada, CA
pros: They are very good about finding the work-life balance and caring for you as a whole person. Communication to employees is clear and transparent.
cons: If you aren't ready for a high emphasis on Christian values, Biola will not be a good fit for you.

job_title: Resident Advisor (RA) in La Mirada, CA
pros: The Residence Life staff pours a lot into their RA's and wants to make it an enjoyable experience for them as well as their residents. They teach great life and leadership skills.
cons: Only a one year job, but there aren't may cons other than that. The experience you gain by leading people is useful for future careers.

job_title: Event Services Technician in La Mirada, CA
pros: Meet new people every semester and the employers help you understand what they are looking for. They also help you work ethics, values, and other qualities that a student employee needs to prepare for the future.
cons: The pay scale is low because this job is for students but it is worth the time while studying full-time.

review_title: Good values, good place to work
job_title: Anonymous Employee in La Mirada, CA
pros: Biblically centered university with a emphasis on personal and spiritual growth. Good work-life balance. My supervisor and coworkers were awesome. Talked with many "lifers" and people who have been with the university for many years.
cons: Salary is below average for tech workers. Difficult to stay for that reason alone.

job_title: Professor in La Mirada, CA
pros: Great retirement matching, supportive staff and administration, pretty friendly colleagues, and comparable compensation. Overall, a pretty good place to work.
cons: It's very difficult to get a full time position, and most part timers will never get a full time position. Parking is miserable (although that's been alleviated in the last few years).

job_title: Custodian in La Mirada, CA
pros: If you're on the weekend crew, you get to pick which (if any) shifts you take each week. Supervisors and fellow employees are friendly and supportive.
cons: If on the weekend crew, the number of hours you get will be dependent on how many other people want to work each weekend.

job_title: Student IT Technician in La Mirada, CA
pros:
Great opportunity to leave your mark on Biola
Great bosses
Lenient on times if you are a student
Loved my time working here
You learn a lot about what it takes to get a network up and running
cons:
Dirty and hard work
Don't expect to be sitting in an office all day

job_title: Anonymous Employee in La Mirada, CA
pros: Biola really is a great place to work. They put their employees first above all else. They excel in spiritual formation and biblical integration.
cons: They can be a little slow to respond to change. Not always cutting edge, but approaching the edge.

review_title: Great benefits, friendly co-workers, great place to work.
job_title: Web Programmer Analyst in La Mirada, CA
pros: Good health coverage, beautiful campus, half day Fridays during the summer, tuition waiver, food discounts, 8% retirement matching, encouraging work environment.
cons: Pay is below industry average, but they do offer a lot of really good benefits.

job_title: Office Assistant in La Mirada, CA
pros: Nice atmosphere, friendly coworkers. They are willing to work around your class hours
cons: Lacking in challenges often times I finish my work early with plenty of work hours left to spare

job_title: Academic Advising Assistant in La Mirada, CA
pros: Best part about working for Biola is that there is always someone willing to help you do better and move up.
cons: The cons are the pay is usually better somewhere else. But the experience is what matters.

review_title: Couldn't be a better place to work!
job_title: Barista, Conference Service Host, Facilities Custodian, Cafe Worker in La Mirada, CA
pros: Amazing community! Share a faith in The Lord and you get to work with wonderful people.
cons: I never had any. It's a great place to work and I was sad to leave!

review_title: Needs to update salaries and benefits

review_title: Leadership seems to care about you as a person
